definition: to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
see 吃著碗裡，看著鍋裡|吃着碗里，看着锅里[chi1 zhe5 wan3 li3 , kan4 zhe5 guo1 li3]
pinyin: chi1 zhe5 wan3 li3 , qiao2 zhe5 guo1 li3

definition: to do as one sees fit/It's up to you./Let's wait and see and then decide what to do.

sentences.english: 'I am, ' replied the Doger. 'I'd scorn to be anything else.
sentences.chinese: “是啊，”机灵鬼答道，“别的行当我还瞧不上呢。”

sentences.english: The quality of being eccentric . They all goggled at my funny clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他们个个睁大眼睛，瞧着我穿的古怪服装。

sentences.english: See, from my dead lips the ooze exuding at last.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，焦唇终于渗出软腻的细泥。

sentences.english: 65—Look at the fellow in the tall silk.
sentences.chinese: 瞧那个戴大礼帽的家伙。

sentences.english: Look! The little boy is making faces at us.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，那个小男孩在冲我们做鬼脸。

sentences.english: Take a deep breath and feel the beauty of language with heart. Look, you can do it!
sentences.chinese: 深呼一口气，用心感受语言的美妙，瞧，你也能行。

sentences.english: Look, the pavilion is High in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，那亭子高高地立在空中呢。

sentences.english: See the four of us and Chichi sitting in the basket of the hot-air balloon.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，我们四个人和奇奇正坐在热气球的篮子里。

sentences.english: Say , the letter is rather heavy . Let me have it weighed .
sentences.chinese: 瞧，这封信很重，让我来过秤一下吧。

sentences.english: Look, you will know that you are a bag that looks, also can only be used to hold a pen.
sentences.chinese: 瞧你那长相就知道你是一笔袋，也只能用来装笔了。

sentences.english: They looked at me as if ‘as though I were mad.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞧着我好像我发疯了似的。

sentences.english: Look at John checking Money out. Do you think he will ask her out?
sentences.chinese: 你瞧约翰在打量莫尼呢。你觉得他会约她外出幽会吗？

sentences.english: Still excited, he stared at the orangeade in the glass, then tipped his head back and took several deep draughts.
sentences.chinese: 他兴奋不已地瞧了瞧桔子水，然后仰起头大口喝起来。

sentences.english: Still excited, he stared at the orangeade in the glass, then tipped his head back and took several deep draughts.
sentences.chinese: 他兴奋不已地瞧了瞧桔子水，然后仰起头大口喝起来。

definition: to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to cast sidelong glances at sb
to take aim/(fig.) to aim one's looks at/to glance at
to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to turn one's head/to turn around
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to take a furtive look at
